description.narrative: The development objective of the Inclusive Innovation Project for Vietnam is to adopt, upgrade and develop inclusive innovations for the benefit of the Base of Pyramid population.(BoP). The project has four components. The first component is development of inclusive technologies. This component will provide support: (i) developing technological solutions to address a few National Development Challenges (NDCs) that are specific to Vietnam; and (ii) developing, acquiring, adapting and upgrading inclusive technologies by Research and Development (R&D) institutions, enterprises and grassroots innovators. The second component is scale up and commercialization of inclusive technologies. This component will provide loans and matching grants to private enterprises for upgrading, scaling up and commercialization of inclusive technologies. This will include: (i) support enterprises for scaling up, commercialization and sustainable production of inclusive technologies dealing with manufacturing of products and delivery of services for the BoP; and (ii) funding to private sector Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) for the acquisition, adoption and use of technology and innovations in priority areas with significant potential for technological upgrading and growth. The third component is capacity building and global knowledge transfer. The project will support capacity building of key Vietnamese national institutions such as the National Institute of Medicine Materials (NIMM), the National Hospital of Traditional Medicine (NHTM), National Foundation for Science and Technology Development (NAFOSTED), Vietnam Academy of Sciences and Technology (VAST), Hanoi University of Science and Technology (HUST) for the sustainable development and delivery of inclusive technologies in the priority areas supported under the project: a) enhancing technology, quality and clinical trials of traditi

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Section I.A.3 of Schedule to the PA | Description :Within 1 month before the first call for proposals, NAFOSTEDshall establish and thereafter maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, a technical panel of experts. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Sections I.A.1 and I.A.4 of Schedule to the PA | Description :By no later than 3 months after the EffectiveDate, NAFOSTED shall incorporate to its Board a representative of the private sector and shall select and engage and thereaftermaintain throughout the period of implementation of the Project, the services of an internationally experienced technical advisor |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Sections I.A.1, 2, and I.C. of Schedule 2 to FA; Section I.A.2 of Schedule to PA | Description :Maintainappropriate project implementation arrangements throughout the duration of the Project. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Sections I.A.3.a and I.A.3.b of Schedule 2 to FA | Description :By no later than 3 months after the EffectiveDate, select and engage the services of an internationally selected Project advisor; By no later than 6 months after the EffectiveDate, select and engage the services of a monitoring and evaluation expert. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Sections I.F of the Schedule to the PA | Description :NAFOSTED to develop and adopt a grievance redressalmechanism for the processing of any complaints related to the various sub-grants. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Intermediate Result indicator One: Number of laboratories/ plants upgraded
1. Number of pilot inclusive technologies developed/upgraded that are likely to benefit the BoP
Intermediate Result indicator Two: Number of pilot inclusive technology solutions funded
Intermediate Result indicator Two: A network of domestic and /or global organizations formed
Intermediate Result indicator Three: Number of grassroots innovations funded
Intermediate Result indicator Two: Number of SMEs technology upgrading projects funded
Intermediate Result indicator One : Number of NDC Solutions funded
2. Number of pilot inclusive technologies Commercialized that are likely to benefit the BoP
Intermediate Result indicator One: Number of pilot inclusive technologies commercialization sub-projects funded
Intermediate Result indicator One: PMU and PIU maintained during the project implementation and staffed with required technical and professional experts according to agreed TORs
Intermediate Result indicator Two: Financial management and procurement management systems established and maintained with FM and procurement professionals engaged throughout the project
Intermediate Result indicator Three: M&E system established and M&E reports delivered on time
